meanings.sent1: The hardfisted man refused to buy anything that wasn't on sale.
meanings.sent2: She was known for her hardfisted approach to finances, always saving every penny.
meanings.sent3: The hardfisted millionaire even haggled over the price of a cup of coffee.
meanings.sent4: His hardfisted ways with money made him as tight as a closed fist.
meanings.sent5: The hardfisted character in the story never parted with a single coin.

meanings.definition: Using force or authority in a harsh or oppressive manner.
meanings.sent1: The hardfisted ruler ruled with an iron fist, silencing any opposition.
meanings.sent2: The hardfisted boss demanded long hours and offered no breaks.
meanings.sent3: The hardfisted teacher gave extra homework on weekends just for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her hardfisted leadership style crushed the spirits of her employees.
meanings.sent5: The hardfisted general commanded his troops with unwavering severity.

meanings.definition: Having a tight grip or grasp.
meanings.sent1: The hardfisted toddler held onto the toy with all his might.
meanings.sent2: The hardfisted handshake of the old man showed years of strength.
meanings.sent3: The hardfisted monkey refused to let go of the banana, even when offered a treat.
meanings.sent4: Her hardfisted grip on the steering wheel made her knuckles turn white.
meanings.sent5: The hardfisted wrestler easily pinned down his opponent with a firm hold.
